instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00239 VDH002 SSD not recognized
threads.message: This was a minor spill. Can't find any corrosion other than on the USB-C connector on the power button side. Lifeboat is connected. Computer turns on and gets stuck at the critical update page, which is expected when it can't find the internal SSD. Any idea where to start with this?

threads.title: 820-00239 VDH002 SSD not recognized
threads.message: Thanks, great information. That trace is fine on my board, but it's good to know for future situations.

threads.title: 820-00239 VDH002 SSD not recognized
threads.message: Crater on the board on pin 1 of C9401. Shorted. Oh well.

threads.title: 820-00239 VDH002 SSD not recognized
threads.message: Try to isolate that pad and make a bypass on PPVIN_2V7NAND_LB power rail.

threads.title: 820-00239 VDH002 SSD not recognized
threads.message: The crater runs deep, not sure how I could possibly separate the shorted layers. Unless there's something I'm missing, I think I'll probably just have to turn this into a test board.

threads.title: 820-00239 VDH002 SSD not recognized
threads.message:
Drill 1-2mm deep and polish the edge, trying to eliminate burnt area.
Maybe need to make a hole of 2-3mm diameter.
Go deep enough to clean carbonized area, but stop before reach the other board side.
Nothing to lose in this case; the board is trash anyway.
